synopsis.text: Hero-King Inglis lived a life of loyal service to his country as a divine knight and lord of the realm. On his deathbed, his one unfulfilled wish was to experience life as a frontline warrior rather than a king. By fortune, his wish is granted by the goddess Alistia, who reincarnates Inglis in the far future as the daughter of a noble family. However, Inglis soon discovers an unexpected challenge - in this era, utilizing magic requires runes that she lacks, making her ineligible to become a knight. Undeterred, Inglis views this as an opportunity to prove that knighthood is defined by one's grit on the battlefield rather than by bloodline. She decides to become a squire instead, pushing her limits to master the martial arts and blade, perhaps even becoming an extraordinary squire in the process. With her wish for a second life granted, Inglis now pursues her long-held dream of focusing purely on combat training and skills. Faced with new trials in this familiar yet different world, Inglis remains ambitious to hone her talents to the fullest.
synopsis.author: anthropic.claude-v2:1
